fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
Eurosif follows several key topics at an EU policy level including:  
- Non-Financial & Diversity Disclosure Directive 
- the Capital Markets Union Action Plan 
- Regulatory technical standards about PRIIPs KID 
- the PANA Committee of Inquiry 
- the ESA review
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: High-Level Expert Group on Sustainable Finance#E03485#MICILOTTA Flavia#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3485#Member#B#Other
membership: The GSIA - formed with other regional Sustainable Investment Forums (SIF in the US, SIO in Canada, Japan and RIAA in Australia). More info: http://www.gsi-alliance.org/
relevant_communication: Eurosif is running a biennial European Market SRI Study, which is recognized as the authoritative study on sustainable and responsible investment in Europe.
goals__remit: Eurosif is the leading pan-European sustainable and responsible investment (SRI) membership organisation whose mission is to promote sustainability through European financial markets. Eurosif works as in partnership with Europe-based national Sustainable Investment Forums (SIFs), and with the direct support of their network which spans more than 400 Europe-based organisations drawn from the sustainable investment industry value chain. These organisations include institutional investors, asset managers, financial services, index providers and ESG research and analysis firms, totalling over €8 trillion in assets. Eurosif is also a founding member of the Global Sustainable Investment Alliance, the alliance of the largest SIFs around the world. The main activities of Eurosif are public policy, research and creating platforms for nurturing sustainable investing best practices.
